Emily Tiry

Github / Twitter

Employment

Research Associate I

Urban Institute
Washington, DC
2017 to Present

Research Associate II

Urban Institute
Washington, DC
2013 to 2016

Principal/co-principal investigator for an evaluation of Medicaid access for halfway house residents (National Institute of Justice) and a jail population analysis and preliminary risk assessment development (Bureau of Justice Assistance).

Project/data collection manager for a research project on law enforcement agency social media use and engagement (Office of Community Oriented Policing Services) and the 2014 Census of Publicly Funded Forensic Crime Laboratories (Bureau of Justice Statistics).

Lead data analyst for the development and validation of an actuarial risk assessment tool for youth who have sexually offended (National Institute of Justice) and an evaluation of aggression management treatment programs for youth in secure facilities (National Institute of Justice).

Research Assistant

Duke University
2013

Conducted literature review of previous employment-based reentry programs and analyzed recidivism outcomes for a prisoner reentry program evaluation. Researched several firearms policy topics. Created charts using Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network (OPTN) data and analyzed mortality data from the Centers for Disease Control for an organ transplantation symposium report.

Summer Associate

North Carolina Division of Public Health
2012

Collected and analyzed data from the North Carolina Controlled Substances Reporting System (NC CSRS). Presented results to the advisory boards of the NC CSRS and Chronic Pain Initiative. Prepared policy memo on Good Samaritan laws for drug overdoses.

Education

Master of Public Policy

Duke University
Durham, NC
2013

Thesis: Reducing Unintentional Prescription Drug Overdose Deaths in North Carolina: Policy Implications based on Current Public Health Surveillance Systems and Law Enforcement Records

B.A. in Political Science

University of Wisconsin - Stevens Point
Stevens Point, WI
2009
